references.paper_title: Measuring the Hardness of SAT Instances
references.reason: This paper introduces a key concept of core, which is central to the methodology in the current paper.
This handbook provides a comprehensive overview of the SAT problem, including core concepts and algorithms, which are foundational to the current paper.

references.paper_title: Learning to generate industrial sat instances
references.reason: This is one of the earliest works applying deep learning to SAT problem generation, providing a baseline for comparison and context for the current work.
This paper proposes a graph-based generative model for SAT problems, directly influencing the methodology used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: HardSATGEN: Understanding the Difficulty of Hard SAT Formula Generation and A Strong Structure-Hardness-Aware Baseline
references.reason: This recent work addresses the challenge of generating hard SAT instances, offering a direct comparison and showing improvement over previous methods.
